loans.name: Ladia

texts.en:
Ladia lives in West Point, Liberia, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County.  She is 40 years old and married to a businessman.  They have five children between the ages of 2 and 24, who are in school and live at home.  For 10 years Ladia has been operating a shop in her community where she sells soft drinks, cold water and phone credit cards.  

She received a small amount of money from her husband to start her business, and she learned how to manage it from her mother.  Ladia likes her business because she makes more profit.  She is requesting her 3rd loan to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and phone credit cards to resell in her business. Ladia plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and phone credit cards to resell in her business.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 27 years old and lives in the West Point area. She’s married with three children, ages 3, 10 and 12 years old, who live at home and attend school. For the past 2 years, she has been involved in cooking and selling rice and soup in the local market. What she likes about this business is that it helps her feed her children, and she feels proud of making her own money and paying her children's school fees.

She has requested this loan to purchase more rice, fish, oil, meat, coal, pepper, etc. for her business. In the future, she plans to have her own house and build a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, oil, meat, coal, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta is 35 years old and lives in West Point. She’s married and her husband is a contractor at a construction firm. They both have four children between the ages of 14 and 20. All the children attend school. 

For the past two years, Satta has been selling palm oil in the local market. Although, during the raining season her sales are low, she nevertheless makes a profit.

Satta is requesting a loan to purchase 20 gallons of palm oil for her business. She plans to send her children to the university and to build a house for them in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 20 gallons of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Moijan

texts.en:
Moijan is 59 years old and lives in West Point.  She is married and has 5 children between 20 to 30 years old.  Only the younger one is attending school and lives with her at home. For the past two years she has been selling rice, pepper, vita (spices), salt, etc. in her community market. She enjoys it a lot since she has many customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, vita (spices), salt, etc. for her business. She plans to build her house and live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, vita (spices), salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Magret is 21 years old and married with one child. She would like to start a small business, selling ie lavalava (cloth used for clothing) in her community. 

In order to do this, Magret needs a loan to buy material, fabric color paints, stencils, a paint roller, and an elei carved board. 

She hopes to use her profits to save for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric color paints, stencils, a paint roller, and an elei carved board

loans.name: Seap's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Seap is 45 years and married with six children, three of whom are dependents. For more than 10 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income to make a living. They can earn about KHR 26,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 16,000 each day for their future needs.
 
Seap has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to make her living conditions better. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn, 40, lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, where she is married and the mother of three children. The family’s main sources of income derive from planting cassava, farming rice and growing corn in the local village. In business for six years, Thorn earns about 22,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Thorn is requesting her first loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this will enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Hermes

texts.en:
Hermes earns a living through his barber shop business. He lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Hermes has been in the business for more than three years now.

Hermes is asking for a loan to buy materials for his barber shop like scissors, razors, hair products and others. With this, he will be able to improve his business, thus allowing him to cater to more customers in his shop.

loans.use: to buy materials for his barber shop like scissors, razors, hair products and others.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is an experienced agronomist form Metsamor village of the Armavir region. She lives with her father-in-law, son, daughter-in-law, 9-year-old granddaughter and 1-year-old grandson. 

With the help of her family members, Tamara is engaged in breeding livestock of piglets, and in cultivation of beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, eggplants, greens, peaches, apricots, grapes and apples. Her son sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

Agribusiness is the only source of the family's income. To continue running her business in a sustainable way, Tamara needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase polyethylene for the greenhouse and to buy tomato seeds. 

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Tamara was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

Tamara and her big family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene for the greenhouse, and to buy tomato seeds.

loans.name: Sokeang

texts.en:
Sokeang is 21 years old, single, and a year-three student at Norton University. She lives with her parents and her other three siblings in Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province.

Sokeang entered the Faculty of Economics and Management program after she graduated from high school in 2011. Her main major is Economics. She has a passion for her major because she is aware that this major is suitable for her personality. Sokeang’s education was subsidized by her parents: her mother is a market-vendor and her father is a farmer, growing beans for sale.

Every year, Sokeang faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the school year, when the additional expenses that are needed to cover college fees are due. She is requesting a loan to pay for her college tuition fees. Sokeang plans to finish university education and use her professional skills in a high-paying company. Sokeang is the borrower of the loan. Her mother stands next to her in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for her college tuition fees.

loans.name: Emm's Group

texts.en:
Emm is a 25-year-old mother of two children who earns a living through farming rice on a three-hectare area of farmland. She has been in this business for five years and the current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 

Emm is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Blanca Rosa es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora y joven de 25 años de edad, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 1 hijo el cual estudia en una escuela de la comunidad. En compañía de su esposo se dedica a la caficultura desde hace más de 10 años actividad que aprendió en compañía de sus padres siendo ellos agricultores por muchos años. Sus clientes son personas de su comunidad e intermediarios que llegan a la zona por su popularidad ya que el grano que ella vende es higiénico y con un sabor agradable. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 15 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando. Ella tiene un grado de educación de secundaria completo la cual pudo terminar cursando el plan básico en su totalidad gracias al apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. 
Hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar abono, fertilizantes y otros insumos que ayuden a prevenir que sus cultivos se infecten con la roya y otras plagas que deterioran la calidad del grano.
Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación dando variedad a sus clientes y todos aquellos que consumen su producto para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar para fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos y sus nietos y que sean ellos los que sigan trabajando la tierra de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa is a young, enterprising go-getter. She is 25 years old, married with 1 son who studies at a school in the community. She and her husband have been growing coffee for more than 10 years, an activity that she learned from her parents as they were farmers for many years. Her customers are the people in her community and the middlemen who come to the area because of the popularity of the grain she sells which is hygienic and delicious. Her crops are located some 15 minutes walking distance from her home. She completed her secondary education. She was able to finish her basic studies completely due to the financial support from her parents.

Today she is asking for help in order to buy compost, fertilizers and other supplies to help prevent her crops from becoming infected with rust and pests that damage the quality of the grain.

Her plans for the future are to expand the farm, offering a variety to her customers and all those who consume her product so she can generate more earnings, so those who will be coming will strengthen the assets for the children and grandchildren, as they are the ones who will continue working the land from generation to generation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to apply to her coffee crops

loans.name: Tsaghik

texts.en:
Tsaghik is an experienced farmer from Noramarg village of the Ararat region. She lives with her son and daughter-in-law. Her son is a contractual serviceman in the military service, and her daughter is employed in the private sector. They work hard to be able to earn a living for the family. 

It's already more than 18 years that Tsaghik has been extensively engaged in agribusiness. She is involved in cattle breeding, in breeding livestock of piglets, hens, and turkeys, and in cultivation of alfalfa. Agribusiness is an important source of income. She sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

To sustain her agribusiness, Tsaghik needs a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase two calves, to buy potato seeds, and to pay for the workforce for the harvesting services. She and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two calves, to buy potato seeds, and to pay for the workforce for the harvesting services.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, tiene 35 años de edad, está soltero y vive en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, lleva 4 años de tener sus propios cultivos de café, maíz y frijoles para la venta. La producción es vendida en la misma zona donde vive. El ha solicitado el tercer ciclo de préstamo el cual es por 7,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos para darle mantenimiento a los cultivos de maíz y frijoles y así podrá obtener una mejor cosecha. Su meta es comprar más terreno para ampliar los cultivos.
texts.en:
Antonio is 35 years old. He is unmarried and lives in the city of San Marcos in the department of Santa Barbara. Since he was very young he has been a farmer. He has been selling his own crops of coffee, corn and beans for four years. He sells his products in the same area where he lives. 

He has applied for his third loan in the amount of 7,000 HNL and will use it to purchase supplies and fertilizer to care for his crops of corn and beans. Thus he will have a better harvest. His goal is to purchase more land to expand his crop production.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizer to care for his crops of corn and beans.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is 56 years old, married and lives with her husband  and five children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shop in which he sells bed sheets, pillows, foam mattress, blankets and other items. Recently he has had to spend a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which has reduced his ability to buy new blankets to sell. This is a problem because demand is now high because winter is approaching. So Khursheed is requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy bedding to sell because it makes loans without asking about assets. Her dream is to provide all of her children with a good life, and she is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane, 67 years old and from the town of Telav, lives with his wife. The operator of a newly-started confectionery store that he runs with a partner,  Ivane sells various pies and rolls. The store is located near a public school, and his regular clients are children. He also distributes his products to the local grocery stores, thereby earning a monthly income. 

In order to develop business and increase sales, Ivane is requesting a loan from MFO Credo to purchase a stock of fizzy drinks and sweets to enlarge his product offerings to attract more customers and increase profit. A very enthusiastic man, Ivane hopes his initiative will be lucrative. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to add a stock of fizzy drinks and sweets to his store

loans.name: Manik

texts.en:
Manik is an experienced agronomist from the Goravan village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, daughter and son. Manik's husband and daughter work in the private sector. To be able to meet the needs of the family, Manik is engaged in cattle breeding and in the cultivation of tomatoes and several fruits (peaches, apricots, quince, and grapes). With the help of her son she sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

Farming is a very important source of income for the family. Manik currently needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a more efficient way. A loan of USD 1,550 will greatly support her business, enabling her to renovate the cattle barn and to purchase a calf. Manik and her family will highly appreciate the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for helping her collect the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the cattle barn and to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Arjet

texts.en:
This is Arjet, a 23-year-old hard working man and a married father of a year-old child. Arjet is running a livestock activity that he started about two years ago. Until then, he worked as a herdsman in a village, but it is very difficult to get there by vehicle because the road is unpaved and bumpy. This would be his first loan. 

“While I was watching others peoples’ livestock, I thought why not watch my own? So I bought some then to start off and I want to add some more at the moment. Since the start, I have been making goat cheese and selling it at the market in addition to baby goats. I like the whole activity and I really want to expand it,” said Arjet.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan is a farmer from the Horom village of the Shirak region. He lives with his wife, son, and daughter-in-law. Vahan's son works in the village school. The salary that he gets there is so low that he cannot cover the needs of the family. 

Vahan is engaged in agriculture and in cultivation of wheat, potato, and alfalfa. Farming is an important source of income for the family. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. To be able to meet the growing needs of his family, Vahan needs a loan of $1,500 to purchase three calves, to buy some forage for them, and to pay for harvesting services. 

This investment in his agribusiness will make it function in a more sustainable way. Vahan and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in funding the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase three calves, to buy some forage for them, and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Huvaydo

texts.ru:
Хувайдо добрая и трудолюбивая  женщина в возрасте  51 лет.  Она  живет в сельской местности Дж. Расуловского р-н.  Имеет двоих детей. Хувайдо мать одиночка. К сожалению по личным причинам она развелась со своим мужем и воспитывает своих детей одна. Хувайдо  работает в детском саду воспитательницей. Ей очень нравится ее работа так как она очень любит детей. Но Хувайдо  получает очень низкую заработную плату.  Поэтому  её сын работает в Российской Федерации. Сын по возможности  каждый месяц отправляет денежные средства своей маме. 
Хувайдо очень долгое время хотела построить дом,и в прошлом году она начала строить но не достроила,так как не имела достаточно денежных средств  на руках.  Сейчас Хувайдо планирует достроить дом но ей все же не хватает немного денежных средств и поэтому она обратилась в организацию Арванд за кредитом.  Скоро наступят холода и Хувайдо хочет побыстрей достроить свой дом. 
На полученный кредит Хувайдо планирует купить строительные материалы и надеется,что  достроит свой дом до зимнего периода. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Huvaydo is a kind and hardworking woman who is 51 years old. She lives in a rural area of the J. Rasulov District. She has two children. Huvaydo is a single mother. Unfortunately, for personal reasons she divorced her husband and is raising her children alone. Huvaydo works in a nursery school as a child-minder. She likes her work a lot as she really loves children. However, Huvaydo receives a very low salary. This is why her son works in the Russian Federation. Her son sends her monthly remittances when possible.    

For a long time now, Huvaydo has wanted to build a house. Last year, she started construction but did not finish building it, as she did not have enough money on hand. Now Huvaydo plans to finish building her house, however she does not have enough money, which is why she turned to Arvand microcredit organization for a loan. It will soon turn cold and Huvaydo would like to finish building her house as soon as possible.

With the received loan, Huvaydo plans to buy construction materials and hopes to finish her house before winter. She thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish building her house.

loans.name: Gencevi

texts.en:
Gencevi is 35 year-old. He has a lovely family and lives with his wife and two sons. Gencevi’s sons are aged 5 and 7. His family are IDPs (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city for 20 years and now live in Bala-Bahmanli village of Füzuli region. His wife Shaiqa is a housewife, his elder son Mehman goes to the first grade and his other son Elcin goes to kindergarden.
Gencevi has cows. He buy young cattle, raises them and sells them in the local bazaar to earn money. Now, Gencevi wants to buy more cows to increase business. Therefore he needs 1,000 AZN.
Gencevi is thankful for this aid from Kiva and Komak. He wants to build a big barn for the cows and to increase business in the future, and in this way his income will be better.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is 44 years old. He is married with two children and lives with his family in Mastaga, a village in Baku region, Azerbaijan. His elder daughter is a student of the first course (first year) at a university, and his little daughter is in tenth grade.

Adil is a taxi driver who has been in this business for four years. He has applied for a loan of 500 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to repair his taxi. He wants to buy wheels and an engine for the car.  Of course, after his car is repaired, his monthly income will be better.

Adil is thankful to Komak and Kiva for their help. In the future, he wants to buy a new car.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Shalala

texts.en:
Shalala is 44 years old. She is married with five children. Shalala sells stationery in her shop. She has selling experience from the past one year. She knows customers' needs and she has reliable providers because Shalala was a market vendor in a grocery store.

Previously she used to sell various products in her shop. Now she is focused only on selling items for school children and students. She is running the business with the support of her husband. She has a shop in the central bazaar. 

Shalala has good sales, due to her location near schools and other educational centers. She has taken three loans from AqroInvest previously. Now she requires a loan of 2000 AZN. With this money she plans to purchase more items for the new semester, when pupils and students return to attend schools and colleges.

loans.use: to purchase more items for the new school semester

loans.name: Armenak

texts.en:
Armenak is very happy with his deal with Kiva for the second time and, as he used to say, he has a reliable partner for his business like Kiva. So he continues to manage his greenhouse activities in Kapan city with his family and it brings in the main part of the family's income. Armenak grows herbs and vegetables such as parsley, radishes, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, beans, coriander and onions and all these he successfully manages to sell to their city markets. Armenak is a very clever and prudent farmer and, as he says, he always tries to be informed about any innovation connected with agricultural activities, particularly anything connected with greenhouse care or anything that can be cultivated there. 
 
This time, Armenak needs a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams in order to buy plastic covers for his greenhouse, some fertilizer, soil and seedlings.

loans.use: To buy plastic covers for his greenhouse, fertilizer, soil and seedlings

loans.name: Bewarij Group

texts.en:
Dunia is the featured borrower of Bewarij's group. She joined with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua since they have always been neighbors and friends.

Dunia is a 45-year old married mother of four children, who runs a snack shop where she sells her delicious sandwiches for the last four years to support her family and improve their living.

Dunia is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special offer products such as chips, soft drinks and new chocolate items too.

She is the first lady from the left wearing a pink top.

As for the other group members, Manar is sitting in the middle, and Layla is the first one from the right with a brown top.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special offer products such as chips, soft drinks and new chocolate items.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Парвизу 25 лет. Он живет в городе Исфара. Парвиз женат. Два года назад он стал отцом. Его жена и милая дочка для Парвиза стимул и продвижение вперед. Сейчас Парвиз безработный и собирается начать торговый бизнес. Он хочет заняться куплей и продажей овощей. Причина, по которой он выбрал именно эту деятельность, то что его тетя продает овощи уже несколько лет, и именно она будет помогать Парвизу с работой. Парвиз берет кредит, чтобы закупить овощи для дальнейшей перепродажи. Он уже приобрел торговую точку на рынке и теперь ожидает поддержки, чтобы приобрести товар.
texts.en: Parviz is 25 years old and lives in the city of Isfarat.  He is married and became a father two years ago.  Parviz's wife and young daughter give him the strength and motivation to move forward.  As he is currently unemployed, Parviz is planning to start his own business buying and selling vegetables.  The reason why he chose this particular business is that his aunt has been selling vegetables for a few years already, and she will be able to provide help. Parviz is taking a loan to buy vegetables for resale.  He already has a retail outlet at the market and he is now waiting for financial support in order to purchase some merchandise.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is from the Noramarg section of Ararat village.  She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, school-age grandson and two little granddaughters (5 and 2 years old). She is a teacher at the local village school, and her husband and son are construction workers. The family works hard to earn a living. For more than 13 years Mareta has been farming, rising beans, potatos, greens and alfalfa. The family sells its agricultural products in the local market. To continue her farming activities in a sustainable way, Mareta needs a loan for $1,600 to buy three calves, to renovate the barn, to buy seeds, and to pay for the workforce to harvest her goods. She and her big family rely on the goodwill of lenders and are thankful to them for their support in sustaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy three calves, renovate her barn, buy seeds, and hire workers to harvest her produce.

loans.name: Vagharshak

texts.en: Vagharshak is a young private entrepreneur from Gyumri city in the Shirak region. He lives with his parents. Vagharshak is the only breadwinner of the family. He runs a local retail shop selling women's clothes and handbags. The assortment of items sold in his shop is not that big and needs to be expanded and updated periodically in order for his small business to function in a sustainable way. Vagharshak currently needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase women's clothing, suitcases and handbags to resell in his shop. With the help of the loan, Vagharshak's small business will become more compatible. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Vagharshak was able to run his business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Vagharshak will be thankful to all the lenders for helping him to maintain and develop his small business.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing, suitcases and handbags to resell in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea, se decidió por otro crédito para reactivar su negocio ella hoy tiene otra actividad económica  la cual es venta de ropa y productos EVON, con la inversión comprara ropa (variedad estilos, colores, y tallas), lociones cremas corporales, etc., esto le ayudar a que su inventario este surtido adecuadamente.
Con el préstamo anterior ella respondió a la demanda de sus clientes, atrajo nuevos,  clientes sus ganancias fueron mejores y salió de sus deudas.
Timotea adquirió un televisor con sus ganancias y está siendo a poyada en la venta de catálogo por sus hijos.
texts.en:
Timotea, opted to take out a new loan to restart her business. She has another job at the moment which is selling clothes and EVON products. 

With the loan she will buy clothes (different styles, colors and sizes), lotions, body creams etc. 

This helps to keep her inventory adequately stocked. 

With the previous loan she was able to respond to her clients demand and attracted new ones. 

Her profits were better and she acquired no debt. 

Timotea bought a television with her profits. Her children are helping her with mail order business.

loans.use: to buy clothes (different styles, colors and sizes), lotions, body creams etc.

loans.name: Kujtim

texts.en: This is Kujtim with his wife Drane and their cute newborn baby! They have two other young kids also. For the past five years, their focus has been on livestock. Drane says, "What better can someone who lives in a village and has no clue about education or civilization do? Livestock is in our blood. We can do it very well and make an income out of it to raise our children. The more animals you have, the more money you earn. So, at this point we would like to add two more animals to our existing herd to increase our income. A loan will be tremendously helpful in our situation." “We would like to thank lenders in advance for their kindness,” added Kujtim.

loans.use: to add two more milk cows to the small existing herd

loans.name: José Oscar

texts.es:
José de 43 años,  estudio hasta séptimo grado en la escuela del Cantón,  caminaba junto con sus hermanos 3 km hasta la escuela, cuando falleció su mamá, su padre ya no los pudo mandar a la escuela y se dedico a trabajar en el campo con su papá y el resto de sus hermanos. 

Él esta acompañado, quien hace solo el oficio de la casa y cuida de sus 5 hijos de 17, 16, 15 , 13 y 5 años de edad respectivamente. solo el hijo varón estudia actualmente, por la mañana y por las tardes recibe un curso de panadería.
    

José  trabaja la agricultura , siembra 1.10 ha de maíz y 0.35 ha de frijol rojo desde que tenia 7 años con su padre y trabaja de forma independiente desde los 13 años, ademas trabaja como ayudante comprador de yuca, en los alrededores donde sus labor es arrancar la yuca y transportarla hasta el mercado de la ciudad de. En ratos libres trabaja los cultivos propios con su familia.  Los cultivos le quedan cerca de su casa, pero los insumos los tiene que comprar en la ciudad recorriendo unos 7 km hasta la cuidad y luego acarrear en su espalda los insumos hasta los sitios de cultivo. 


El préstamo sera invertido en el alquiler de 1.05 ha de tierra para sembrar yuca o mandioca, compra del material se siembra, preparación del terreno y compra de insumos, para realizar el cultivo (herbicidas y fertilizantes) la mano de obra la pondrá él y su familia para el manejo de agroquimicos del cultivo. 

Con el préstamo el cliente espera tener mas ingresos para su familia, ya que él a visto una oportunidad de negocio con este cultivo, ya que ocupa poco trabajo después de su implementación y con la humedad residual del terreno el cultivo se desarrolla y cuando empieza la época de lluvias engruesa las raíces y pueden vender dentro de un año mas o menos, él  a visto como unos agricultores de la zona tienen buenos ingresos extras después de la temporada agrícola.      


El cliente planifica que con el préstamo, podrá tener mas ingresos adicionales para su familia y la posibilidad de poder ampliar su casa, ya que sus hijos ya están grandes y necesitan mas espacio. Ademas, poner a las hijas a la escuela de nuevo, ya que actualmente solo el hijo varón estudia.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old. He studied until the seventh grade in the canton school, walking with his brothers 3 kilometers to school. When his mother died, his father could no longer send him to school so he worked in the field with his father and his brothers.

He is married and his wife takes care of the house and the 5 children who are 17, 16, 15, 13, and 5 years old, respectively. His only son is currently studying in the morning and afternoon, taking a baking course. José works the land, planting 1.10 hectares of corn and 0.35 hectare of red beans. He worked with his father since he was 7 years old, and then independently since he was 13. He also works as an assistant buyer of cassava in the area where he works picking out the cassava and transporting it to the city market. In his free time he works with his family on his own crops. His crops are near his home, but he has to buy the supplies in the city traveling some 7 kilometers towards the city and later he returns carting the supplies on his back to the farming site.

He will invest the loan in the rental of 1.05 hectares of land to plant cassava or manioc, buying agricultural supplies, preparing the land, and buying supplies (herbicides and fertilizers). He and his family will do the manual labor of handling the crop agrochemicals.

The customer hopes that with this loan he will have more income for his family, as he sees this as a business opportunity with this crop, as it takes little work after implementation and with the residual moist land his crop develops and when the rainy season begins the roots thicken and they can sell within a year or so. He has seen some of the farmers from the area have good extra income after harvesting season.

The borrower plans that the loan will provide additional income for his family and the possibility of being able to expand his home, as his children are grown and need more space. Also, he would like to place his daughters in school again, as currently only his son is studying.

loans.use: to rent 1.05 hectares of land for planting cassava or manioc, buying agricultural supplies to prepare the land and to buy supplies for cultivation (herbicides and fertilizers) so he and his family can manage the manual labor of handling the agrochemicals for farming.

loans.name: Irma Berenice

texts.es:
Irma Berenice es clienta de Kubo Financiero, y esta es su historia:

Me llamo Berenice, tengo 31 años, soy casada y tengo tres hijos. Me dedico al comercio desde hace 4 años, inicié en esto ya que mi mamá se dedicaba a la maquila de uniformes y yo le ayudaba; por esto desde hace 4 años decidí iniciar con mi negocio.

Fabrico y vendo todo tipo de ropa por temporadas, ahorita por la temporada de invierno estoy fabricando abrigos de todas las tallas. Pido este préstamo ya que es una época fuerte de ventas en el año y necesito comprar más tela para la fabricación de mis abrigos.

Soy responsable en mis pagos y no me gusta quedar mal. Gracias al esfuerzo que dedico a mi negocio he logrado tener mi carro, estabilidad económica y hacer crecer mi negocio.
texts.en:
Irma Berenice is a client of Kubo Financiero.  This is her story:

"My name is Berenice.  I am 31 years old, married, and have three children.  I have been in business for four years.  I started out by helping my mother, who made a living by making uniforms.  For this reason, I decided to start my own business four years ago.  

I make and sell all types of clothing based on the season.  Since winter is approaching, I am making coats in all sizes.  I am requesting this loan since it has been a strong sales season this year.  I will need more fabric for making coats.  

I am responsible with my payments because I don’t want to look bad.  Thanks to the effort I have put into my business, I have been able to acquire a car of my own, become financially stable, and grow my business."

loans.use: to buy fabric for making coats.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús es cliente de Kubo Financiera y esta es su historia:

Soy Jesús y tengo varios negocios: de papelería y renta de internet con los que llevo 6 años, además vendo jarcería desde hace tres años y acabó de aventurarme a abrir una tienda de abarrotes con la que tengo 8 meses.

Me motiva que cerca de mi negocio no tengo competencia y aparte amplío mis clientes yendo todas las mañanas a vender a la escuela cercana, donde ofrezco mi mercancía y rento internet.

Este préstamo me ayudaría para invertir en abarrotes, que es mi más reciente negocio. Me gusta cumplir con mis compromisos y sobre todo porque estos beneficios serán para mi negocio, por el cual he salido adelante.

Mis principales logros es que gracias a mis primeros negocios, como mi papelería, he logrado iniciar la venta de jarcería y abarrotes; esto me motiva a aprovechar la zona sin competencia y para esto quiero más inversión.
texts.en:
Jesús is a client of Kubo Financiero.  This is his story:

“My name is Jesús.  I have several businesses, including a stationery shop and an Internet café that I have managed for the past six years.  In addition, I have been selling cleaning implements for the past three years, which eventually led me to open a grocery store eight months ago.

I am motivated to stay in business since I have no competition and am able to obtain more customers.  Every morning I am able to make sales, since I am located near a school where I can offer my merchandise and provide Internet services.  

This loan will help me to invest in groceries since this is my most recent business.  I like to fulfill my commitments since this they have been beneficial to my business and have helped me to get ahead.  My main accomplishments have been with my first business, the stationery shop, which eventually led me to begin selling cleaning implements and groceries.  I am motivated to take advantage of being in an area with no competition, so I want to invest more.”

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fatima  Asuncion

texts.es:
Fátima es una Señora de 29 años, vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas en casa propia. Esta ciudad es muy comercial y productiva, el clima cálido – húmedo favorece para que en el sector se desarrollen actividades turísticas y también de agricultura y ganadería, lo cual fortalece a la economía de la provincia, además que es un puerto importante por ser el punto de intercambio de las regiones sierra y costa del Ecuador. Muy conocida por la Etnia Taschila que habita en estas tierras. 
Fátima es madre soltera; uno de los obstáculos más difícil de atravesar fue la separación con su esposo cuando su hija estaba muy pequeña. Desde ahí nació la idea de ponerse un negocio para sacar adelante a su familia y darle todos los estudios a su hija que ahora ya tiene 8 años de edad. Y sueña con verla convertida en una profesional ya que Fátima con el esfuerzo de sus padres solo recibió la primaria. 
Fátima comenzó a vender helados y calzado hace 6 años atrás, poco a poco pudo ganar capital, luego con esos ahorros compró computadoras para el cibercafé que ahora tiene 2 años de funcionamiento.  Su negocio se encuentra junto a una escuela por lo que hay mucha afluencia de clientes, acudió a Fundación Alternativa  por muy buenas referencias de la institución,  por sus servicios y la atención que le brindan al cliente. Solicita un crédito para comprar una copiadora y anilladora que es de mucha ayuda para su negocio, ya que sus clientes demandan de estos servicios con mucha frecuencia. Con esta inversión mejorarán sus ingresos y podrá brindar a su hija un mejor estilo de vida sin que le falte nada para salir adelante. Se siente muy agradecida porque le abrieron las puertas y le dieron la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida creyendo en su espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Fátima is a 29 year old woman who lives in her own house in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. The city is very commercialized and productive. It's hot, humid climate favors the development of tourism as well as agriculture and livestock raising, which strengthen the economy of the province. Also it is an important portal for the interchange between the Andes and coastal regions of Ecuador. The Taschia culture who flourished in this land is well-known. 

Fátima is a single mother. One of the most difficult things for her to overcome was the separation from her husband while her child was still very young. From this time came the idea of opening a business to get the family ahead and be able to school her daughter who is now 8 years old. Fátima dreams of seeing her as a professional. Fátima with the help of her parents only managed to finish her primary schooling. 

Six years ago Fátima started to sell ice-cream and shoes. Little by little she created capital. Later with these savings she bought computers for the internet cafe that she has been operating now for two years. Her business is located next to a school and so she has lots of customers. 

Fátima has come to Fundación Alternativa because of it's good reputation for the service and attention it provides it's clients. She is asking for a loan to buy a copier and a ring binding machine which will be a great help to her business as clients request these service frequently. This investment will increase her revenue and she can offer her child a better lifestyle so that nothing stands in her way to get ahead. Fátima feels very grateful that they opened their doors and gave her the opportunity to improve the quality of her life, trusting in her entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to buy a copier and a ring binding machine.

loans.name: Ester Cortez

texts.es: Ester vive en casa propia con su madre y su esposo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, refrescos, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Ester lives in her own house with her mother and her husband. She has a store where she sells daily household items such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, soft drinks, etc. She has been doing this for many years and that gives the experience in sales to maximize her profits. It is located in her home which is located in a heavily trafficked area. She is well-known by her neighbors in the area. She has many clients as the store is well-stocked. She wants to expand her business and make a further investment. But she lacks the necessary capital.

For this reason Ester is requesting a loan to buy what is needed in her store. She assures us that she`ll pay off her loan and at the same time is confident that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías, solicita capital para invertir en la siembra de granos básicos, comprara semilla, fertilizantes, insecticidas y abono, que le sirven para preparar la tierra y tener todo listo para la época de siembra, con el préstamo anterior su cosecha fue más abundante, amplió su negocio y sus ganancias las utilizo para pagar sus deudas.
Ha mejorado su situación económica y da a su familia mejor vida.
texts.en:
Elías is requesting capital so that he can invest in the planting of basic grains.  He will buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and compost, which will help him to prepare the land and have it ready for the planting season.  

With his previous loan, he was able to achieve an abundant harvest, expand his business, and use the profits to pay his debts.  His economic situation has improved and he has been able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Aaron Bryan

texts.es:
Aaron tiene 19 años de edad, vive con sus padres en la calidad ciudad de ICA,  el actualmente trabaja en una empresa familiar como ayudante de carpintería, durante la mañana el dedica su tiempo a sus estudios de administración de empresas.
Aaron está muy agradecido con los prestatarios de KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en estudiar un diplomado en su centro de estudios, conocimientos los cuales lo ayudaran a crecer como profesional y hacer realidad su sueño de la casa propia.
texts.en:
Aaron is 19 years old and lives with his parents in the warm city of Ica.  He currently works at a relative’s business as a carpentry assistant.  In the mornings, he devotes his time to his studies in Business Administration.  

Aaron is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since he will invest the money in a certification course at an educational center.  The knowledge he gains will help him to grow as a professional and fulfill his dream of owning a house.

loans.use: to pay for a certification course.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is 36 years old.  She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase crop production.  With the profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that she can acquire machines and tractors in the future.  This will help to enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition.  This is because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers supports labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of five.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community.  She is doing it for the past 10 years.  She knows the techniques of stitching very well.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, packs of zippers, and buttons.  This will help to meet up with the increasing demand.  In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy threads, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Flor Sarahi

texts.es:
Doña Flor es una mujer feliz, luchadora, emprendedora con una edad de 30 años que no deja de soñar en grande la cual tiene un grado de educación primario completo por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero y moral brindado por sus padres. Ella es casada y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el cual se dedica a la misma actividad. De su matrimonio tiene tres hijos los cuales están en la escuela de la comunidad y ayudan con las actividades del campo a sus padres. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad la cual la aprendió desde muy joven inculcada por sus padres y decidió continuar con esta actividad ya que sus padres la facilitaron un terreno el cual le dieron como herencia para que lo cultivara y generara sus propios ingresos ubicado a una distancia de 1 kilómetros al cual se trasladan caminando.
Doña Flor solicita un financiamiento para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas para su cultivo de café, ya que hoy en día esta clase de productos son caros y la (roya) que es una enfermedad que afecta los cultivos de café si no se trata a tiempo es posible que se contamine y se pierda la cosecha completa.
Sus sueños a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación por sus hijos, sus nietos, y las próximas generaciones que puedan aprovechar el esfuerzo y la dedicación de ella y de su esposo han hecho. También poder apertura un micro empresa para elaboración de chocolate para poder estratificar sus ingresos y generar otros.
texts.en:
Doña Flor is a happy woman, hard-working and entrepreneurial. She is 30 years old and dreams great things. She has completed primary school, for which she is grateful to the financial and moral support offered by her parents. She is married and has the support of her husband, who does the same work. From her marriage she has three children, who attend the community school and help with the work in their parents' fields. She has a lot of experience in this work, which she learned when she was very young, instilled in her by her parents, and she decided to continue with this work, since her parents provided her with a plot of land that they gave her as an inheritance so that she could cultivate it and generate her own income. It is located at a distance of one kilometer, which she traverses by walking.

Doña Flor is applying for a loan to be able to buy fertilizers, compost, and pesticides for her coffee planting, since now these types of products are expensive. Rust is a disease that affects coffee plantings, and if it is not treated in time, it is possible that it will spread and the entire harvest will be lost.

Her dreams for the future are to have a big coffee plantation which can continue to give them benefits and family sustenance and can be worked from generation to generation by her children and grandchildren, and the next generations can take advantage of the effort and dedication that she and her husband have applied. She would also like to be able to open a microbusiness to make chocolate to be able to stratify her income and generate others.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to apply to her coffee plantings

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en: Farkhanda is a 28-year-old married woman.  She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells these to the people of her community.  She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.  Farkhanda is requesting a loan of 25,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation.  This will be used to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and to expand her inventory.  She expects a boost in her earnings and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Razan

texts.en: Razan, age 50, deals in animal sales.  She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices.  She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.  For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase two more goats.  She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.  With this loan she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 40 years old.  He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase crop production.  With the profits from farming he wishes to invest in his business so that he can acquire machines and tractors in the future that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition.  This is because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support the labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anaayt

texts.en:
Anaayt is a 56-year-old, vigorous lady.  She has been stitching clothes for many years.  She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.  By the time she has attained a regular list of customers, she is unable to meet their daily demands.  This is because of the lack of available funds.

For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation.  She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads of different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.  It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time and generate a healthier source of income.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads,  packs of laces,  zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria used the previous loan to buy bananas to sell. She is a young married woman with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her business is selling bananas but she has now started a retail shop so as to earn more income. She started by purchasing ten bunches of bananas but now is able to purchase a lorry. Her challenge is the high cost of bananas and seasonality. Her dream is to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification and own a wholesale shop. 

Victoria is requesting a loan to buy bananas and buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas and buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 39 years old and married with four.  She has spent four years in the business.  She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase crop production.  With profits from farming she wishes to invest in her business so that she can acquire machines and tractors in the future that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition.  This is because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 34-year-old, vigorous lady.  She has been stitching clothes for many years.  She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.  However, due to the lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation.  She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.  It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time.  She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors,  packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Gulam Ayesha

texts.en: Ghulam Ayesha is a 52-year-old married woman.  She has been doing hand embroidery for many years.  She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community.  Her designs are in much demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.  To help her to continue business operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000.  This will be used to buy reels of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment.  In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently.  She is hopeful to increase in her income by targeting more customers.  She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Shahbana

texts.en:
Shahbana is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running her milk selling business for many years. She has 2 cows to milk.  She sells milk to many of her neighbors.  She also sells butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. 

She has improved her business to meet their day-to-day expenses. This is her 2nd year with Kashf Foundation and  she is happily running her business with this support. She is requesting a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to increase the capacity of her business for milk production which ultimately helps to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Alianza Unida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Alianza Unida está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió, está rodeado de una hermosa vegetación gracias a su geografía accidentada, esta bañada por 4 ríos y su arquitectura traslada a su pasado. Las socias son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y emprendedoras que siempre están en la búsqueda de mejorar la economía de sus hogares y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus seres queridos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Enma, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y conocidas del grupo de crédito Alianza Unida, ha sido invitada  a este hermoso grupo por una vecina quien ya es parte hace algún tiempo del grupo.
La Señora Enma tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 22, 15, 12, 5 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo pasa en casa, su segunda hija está estudiando en el colegio y dos de sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora como empleado público, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Enma es toda una profesional en la rama de la belleza, cuenta con su propio gabinete en el que labora desde hace 20 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa, de frutas y verduras. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de quintales de arroz para iniciar con la venta de este producto. Su meta es continuar creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
The loan group Allianza Unida is formed by eight women who live on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city enjoys a cold climate. It is surrounded by beautiful vegetation, thanks to its rugged terrain. It is bathed by four rivers, and its architecture translates its past. The members of the group are hard-working, striving, and entrepreneurial women who always seek to improve the economy of their households and offer a better future to their loved ones.

One of the members of this group is Señora Enma. She is taking out her first loan alongside her friends and acquaintances from the loan group, Allianza Unida. She was invited to this beautiful group by a neighbor who had already been part of the group for some time.

Señora Enma is 37 years old. She is married and has five children, ages 22, 15, 12, 5, and 1. Her oldest son is at home, her second child, a daughter, is in secondary school, and two of her children study in a little city school. Her husband works as a public employee. The house in which they live is their own.

Doña Enma is a total professional in the area of beauty. She has her own salon, in which she has worked for 20 years. She works from Mondays to Saturdays without a fixed schedule. In her free time she sells clothing, fruits, and vegetables.

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of 100-lb sacks of rice to begin selling this product. Her goal is to continue growing in the business.

loans.use: to buy 100-lb sacks of rice

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en: Hasina is a 27-year-old married woman with three children and her husband is 35 years old. They live in the small town of Dhupguri. Hasina is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. They have chosen to grow rice because they own a plot of land, and farming on one’s own land is much more profitable than harvesting crops on someone else’s land. Hasina dreams that her children will get a full education because she and her husband are both illiterate. She also hopes that with the money from selling rice, they will be able to build a pakka house (made of bricks and cement). She wants her children to have a better life than she and her husband have had, and she is thankful to BJS and Kiva for helping to improve their future!

loans.use: to purchase seeds for rice paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 47-year-old widow. She has been successfully running a small canteen shop in a school for the last three years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of two children. Being a single parent, she is motivated to provide for her family. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stock of juices, biscuits and sweets. She would then be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues for the betterment of her family members and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of juices, biscuits and sweets.

loans.name: Asghari

texts.en:
Asghari is 43 years old  and is married. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she started her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her area. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sylvan

texts.en:
Sylvan is 43 years old and is married with five children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez, age 41, is a widow and the mother of 5 children. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. Three years ago she started her business sewing clothes. She is well familiar with stitching techniques and has a good client list. She needs to improve her business so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. It will help her to purchase spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons in various colors to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread along with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons in various colors

loans.name: Jharna

texts.en: Jharna is a 46-year-old married woman and her husband is 55 years old. She is the mother of four children. One of her children is receiving an education and the rest help their father in his business, which is selling clothes door to door. Her husband runs the business and she is a housewife. Due to a lack of money, her husband could not purchase a large variety of good quality clothes. Their product was not up to the mark. They have faced lots of problems in running their family and making money. Jharna decided to help her husband by taking a loan from BJS of INR 15,000 to purchase a lot of different types of clothes that are a better quality, as demanded by the market. They have a plan to open a shop of their own so they can do business on a larger scale and reach more customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en: Kalpana is 30 years old and has two children. Her husband is 42 years old and sells wood in the market to be used for cooking fuel. Both of them are illiterate. Kalpana is a housewife. The quality of wood they currently sell is low, so their profits are not very high. Kalpana wants to help her husband’s business by taking a loan to buy higher quality trees that they can chop up for selling at the market at a higher price. This will help improve their quality of life!

loans.use: to purchase wood to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz, age 38, is a married woman. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to increase her revenues so she can generate a healthier source of income.  She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all her work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Zacharie

texts.en:
Zacharie is 43 years old. He is married with five children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
MODESTA, who is in her late 20s, is married with three children -- two boys and one daughter. She has been running two businesses, a retail shop and a food vending business, for four years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Modesta's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock items in both businesses. She even bought more sodas and is doing great. She appreciates the loan which has made her life move forward. She has managed to pay all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, started building her house, and saved some in the bank. She will use this loan to buy more food, like rice, flour, beans, sugar, salt, etc., to sell. She will also increase the inventory in her retail shop. She dreams of living a better life with her future loans.

Modesta will share this loan with her loan group "Machimbo," with three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food like rice, flour, beans, sugar, and salt to sell. She will also increase inventory for her retail shop.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  is 32 years old and married. Together with her spouse she has been blessed with three children. She has a maize mill business from which she sells maize flour. She has been in this business for two years. Besides this, she also has a retail shop and a poultry business. Her spouse also produces additional income.

This is her first loan term and she will be using the loan to buy more stock of maize for her maize mill business. She also plans to buy more stock of rice, cooking oil, salt and soap to sell in her retail shop. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

Her future hopes are to keep dairy cattle and also to make yoghurt using the milk produced by the cattle.

loans.use: to buy maize and retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Uttara

texts.en: Uttara is a 38-year-old married woman and her husband is 46 years old. She has passed class X (grade 10) and her husband has passed class IV (grade 4). They live in a small town in the Dhupguri region. Uttara has three children and all of them are receiving an education. From the very beginning, Uttara has faced many difficulties in running the family in her small town. Her husband runs a grocery shop but sales have not been good due to a lack of variety. With a loan of INR 15,000, she can purchase many more grocery items to help their business run smoothly.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Sakha

texts.en: Sakha is 31 years old and has three children. Two of them are going to school. Her husband is 35 years old. Sakha has passed class IV (grade 4) and  her husband is illiterate. Selling toys is a profitable business but a wide variety of toys are required and, of course, for that money is required. Like every mother, Sakha dreams of a bright future for her children. Sakha wants to help her husband so that their business can be expanded. She is seeking a loan from BJS so that she can help her husband purchase more toys for selling in the market. That way the sales increase and the profit is higher.

loans.use: to purchase toys to sell in the market.

loans.name: Kilimanjaro Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis, who is in her late 30s, is married with three daughters who are in school. For eight years now, Mwanahamis has been involved with three businesses: a clothes business, selling tap water and motorbike transportation. She is doing fine with all activities and has even been able to employ a few helpers. Mwanahamis works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm each working day and is able to receive a fair profit each month. 

This will be her 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she managed to pay back successfully, she bought two motorbikes for transportation and replenished her clothes business with new fashions. Mwanahamis used her business profit to buy a plot of land where she built a family house. She covered school fees for her daughters and part of her household expenses. Mwanahamis will use this loan to buy another water storage tank to supply more water. She dreams of starting a new poultry business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group KILIMANJARO, which includes 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another water storage tank to supply more water.

loans.name: Bernadetta

texts.en:
Bernadetta has a retail shop that she has been running for 4 years now. She is 39 years old and married, and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with 4 children. Her spouse produces additional income. Besides the retail shop, she also has a cash-crop farming business.

She plans to use this loan amount to stock more goods to sell. These include sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking fat, and milk. She will use the anticipated income to buy farming materials such as fertilizer and seeds.

This is her second loan term, and she paid her previous loan successfully. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by opening another retail shop.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell.

loans.name: Family Group

texts.en:
Fadwa is the featured borrower of Family's Group. She and her beloved family members are acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to cover their needs and develop their living.

Fadwa is a 34-year-old married mother of three children. Two years ago she started working in selling beauty cosmetics from her house to help her husband in covering their family's increasing needs.

Fadwa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to start a new additional business to increase her family's income and develop their living. She will open a small restaurant as an additional income business.  She will ask her husband to help her in running this business since he has wide experience in this domain.

Fadwa is the lady standing at the far left side of the picture wearing brown. Her mother Damia is the older lady with a white veil covering her hair. The two other ladies are her brothers' wives. Sylvia is the lady wearing the gray jacket and Huda is the lady sitting at the right side of the picture.

loans.use: to start a new business

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent is 67 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor during maize production.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad, age 45, is from the village of Pantiani. He is married with one 17-year-old son. Elshad is Azerbaijani, but his family has lived in Georgia for a long time. Elshad is a mini-bus driver and transports people from his village to the neighboring town. Besides, Elshad leads a family agricultural business and breeds four milk cows, whose milk is sold locally. Elshad cultivates his own piece of land and sows potatoes and red beans there. He works hard and tries to give the best to his family members. In spite of his efforts, Elshad’s earnings are still modest and hardly enough for a family of three.
 
Elshad is requesting a loan to start a trading business and purchase stock of fruits and vegetables for resale. He plans to buy merchandise in a neighboring town where prices are lower and sell the products in his village with a price mark-up. Elshad will use his minibus to make deliveries and hopes his business will be lucrative. 

Elshad will develop his trading business gradually and increase sales. He and his family members hope that they will be able to improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of fruits and vegetables and start a trading business

loans.name: Marija

texts.en:
Marija lives in a village of Kosovo.  She is 56 years old and is married and the mother of three children between the ages of 13 to 33 years old. Marija is a hardworking woman who helps her family to improve their lives. As part of family tradition, Marija and her husband sell milk and cheese produced from some sheep that they own and raise. (You can see Marija and her husband in the photo).

At this time they have 30 sheep that she raises and cares for. This agricultural business has been successful and profitable.  Marija has been doing it for a long time and her handwork and dedication are clearly evident. Now, she is asking for a loan to buy food for the upcoming winter season for her sheep. This loan will ensure that she is able to sustain her sheep during the rough season so that they are able to continue to produce dairy for her family and sales. Her goal is to raise the number of sheep she has and to continue to grow her business. Marija is very thankful to Kiva lenders for this kind support!

loans.use: To buy food for the upcoming winter season for sheep

loans.name: Benedick

texts.en:
Benedick is a man of 49 years. He is married to Marieta, and they have four children. He operates a garage in Dagoretti Corner in the outskirts of Kangemi. He has been in this business for 19 years and earns a monthly income of 32,000 shillings.

This will be Benedick's fourth loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy spare parts for his mechanic job. In the future he plans to start another business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicles

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 32 years old and operates a shop selling goods in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.
